documents.document: I just backed this fantastic project -- and you should too! https://t.co/EZasNg0G9g

Senators Collins and Murkowski stood up for women's health time and time again when their Republican colleagues would not. Bravo and thank you for your leadership -- from millions of women across the country.
Reproductive health should never be a partisan issue. Protecting women's health should be common sense for both Republicans and Democrats.

"You ought to be able to choose your own health care provider!" Today we presented @SenatorCollins with the Goldwater award, recognizing Republican champions of reproductive health. https://t.co/vekurcq86I

2017: Northam +19 2016: Clinton +17 2014: Warner +12 2013: McAullife…
RT @ryanstruyk: I still can't get over this. Clinton won college-educated white women by 6 points in 2016. Northam won them by 15 points (!…
@ryanstruyk @CNN by 5-something, in a district that's usually 75% solidly Republican...

We didn't just have a clean sweep in VA. We hit a home run in NJ, expanded Medicaid in Maine, and even moved a solidly red district in Utah to an uncomfortably close margin. Voters are rejecting Trump's agenda, and doing so with gusto.

Tonight was a clear rejection of the anti-woman, anti-lgbtq, anti-immigrant policies of the Trump administration. It also shows you that grassroots action--making phone calls, knocking on doors--works.
Love to see womens health champions elected up and down the VA ballot. Thank you to the planned parenthood volunteers who knocked 350k doors!
